summary: This bill, the IVF for Military Families Act (H.R. 2557), amends Title 10 of the United States Code to provide fertility treatment under the TRICARE Program for active duty members of the uniformed services and their dependents. It mandates coverage for fertility-related care, including in vitro fertilization (IVF), within specific limits. The bill defines infertility and fertility-related care, outlining covered treatments and procedures. It also establishes a program for coordinating fertility-related care and includes a conforming amendment for consistency in other sections of the code. The amendments are scheduled to be effective from October 1, 2027.
